title: 108_s851
content: The "Child Custody Protection Act" may be cited as the short title. Title 18, United States Code, is amended to include a new chapter on the transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits knowingly transporting a minor across state lines to obtain an abortion, violating parental involvement laws. Offenders may face fines or imprisonment. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting a minor across state lines for an abortion without parental consent. Violators may face fines or imprisonment. Exceptions include cases where the minor's life is endangered by a physical condition related to the pregnancy. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting a minor across state lines for an abortion without parental consent. Exceptions include cases where the minor's life is endangered by a physical condition related to the pregnancy. Minors and parents violating this law are protected from prosecution or lawsuits. An affirmative defense is available if the defendant reasonably believed that proper consent or authorization was obtained before the abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act" allows for civil action if a parent is harmed by a violation of the law requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision. The "Child Custody Protection Act" defines parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision as requiring notification or consent from a parent, legal custodian, or person standing in loco parentis. The "Child Custody Protection Act" defines a minor as an individual not older than the maximum age requiring parental notification or consent for abortion, with notification or consent required from a parent, legal custodian, or person standing in loco parentis. The term 'State' includes the District of Columbia and any commonwealth, possession, or other territory of the United States. "117A.
